org.kepler.ssh

Class SshExec

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.ssh.RemoteExec
      • org.kepler.ssh.SshExec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExecInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SftpExec

    public class SshExec
extends RemoteExec
    This class provides functionality to use an SSH session to execute remote commands and to transfer files on a remote machine. A session can be opened using one the following authentication protocols: - public-key - password - keyboard-interactive You can create several sessions to different sites and use any of them referring to it with its user@host. An Ssh object can be used then by anyone anytime to copy file or execute commands without authenticating again. If the session becomes disconnected, the connection will be reopened at the next use, and authentication will be either automatic (public-key, or stored

    Author:
    Norbert Podhorszki Based on - JSch examples http://www.jcraft.com/jsch - OpenSSH 4.3 source code http://www.openssh.com/ - org.sdm.spa.Ssh2Exec Kepler actor Authors of the Kepler actor: Ilkay Altintas, Xiaowen Xin

    • Method Detail

      • openConnection

        public boolean openConnection()
                       throws SshException
        Open the connection to the remote machine now. It is not necessary to call this method! If you do not want to prolong making the connection until the first executeCmd / copyTo / copyFrom, then you need to use this method.
        Specified by:
        openConnection in interface ExecInterface
        Specified by:
        openConnection in class RemoteExec
        Throws:
        SshException

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Close the connection This should be called only when there is no more use of the connection to this user@host Important: the ssh session remains opened as long as this method is not called, therefore, the the whole java application will hang at the end until this method is called.
        Specified by:
        closeConnection in interface ExecInterface
        Specified by:
        closeConnection in class RemoteExec

      • setPortForwardingL

        public void setPortForwardingL(java.lang.String spec)
                        throws SshException
        Set a local port forwarding before the connection is made. Format of the specification: lport:rhost:rport (int:string:int). lport on this host will be forwarded through this session and the remote host to the specified rhost:rport address.
        Throws:
        SshException

      • addPortForwardL

        public void addPortForwardL(java.lang.String spec)
        Add a local port forwarding to an open connection. Format of the specification: lport:rhost:rport (int:string:int). lport on this host will be forwarded through this session and the remote host to the specified rhost:rport address.

      • setPortForwardingR

        public void setPortForwardingR(java.lang.String spec)
                        throws SshException
        Set a remote port forwarding before the connection is made. Format of the specification: rport:lhost:lport (int:string:int). rport on remote host will be forwarded through this session and our local host to the specified lhost:lport address.
        Throws:
        SshException

      • addPortForwardR

        public void addPortForwardR(java.lang.String spec)
        Add a remote port forwarding to an open connection. Format of the specification: rport:lhost:lport (int:string:int). rport on remote host will be forwarded through this session and our local host to the specified lhost:lport address.

      • removePortForwardL

        public void removePortForwardL(int port,
                               boolean closeIfLast)
                        throws SshException
        Remove a local port forwarding.
        Parameters:
        port - the local port that is forwarded.
        closeIfLast - If true, and there are no additional local ports forwarded, close the connection.
        Throws:
        SshException

                               boolean closeIfLast)
                        throws SshException
        Remove a remote port forwarding.
        Parameters:
        port - the remote port that is forwarded.
        closeIfLast - If true, and there are no additional remote ports forwarded, close the connection.
        Throws:
        SshException

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int seconds,
                       boolean stdout,
                       boolean stderr)
        Set timeout for the operations. Timeout should be given in seconds. If 'stdout' is set to true, the timer is restarted whenever there is data on stdout. If 'stderr' is set to true, the timer is restarted whenever there is data on stderr. executeCmd will throw an ExecException, an instance of ExecTimeoutException if the timeout limit is reached. 'seconds' = 0 means no timeout at all. Note: copyTo and copyFrom operations currently do not support timeout. Note: currently, the timer cannot be restarted on stderr events in executeCmd

      • setForcedCleanUp

        public void setForcedCleanUp(boolean foo)
        Specify if killing of remote processes (i.e. clean-up) after error or timeout is required. Unix specific solution is used for clean-up, so do not use it when connecting to another servers. Default is false, of course, but use it whenever you can (i.e. connect to unix machines).

      • executeCmd

        public int executeCmd(java.lang.String command,
                      java.io.OutputStream streamOut,
                      java.io.OutputStream streamErr)
               throws ExecException
        Execute a command on the remote machine. The streams streamOut and streamErr should be provided to get the output and errors.
        Returns:
        exit code of command if execution succeeded,
        Throws:
        ExecTimeoutException - if the command failed because of timeout
        SshException - if an error occurs for the ssh connection during the command execution
        ExecException

      • executeCmd

        public int executeCmd(java.lang.String command,
                      java.io.OutputStream streamOut,
                      java.io.OutputStream streamErr,
                      java.lang.String thirdPartyTarget)
               throws ExecException
        Execute a command on the remote machine and expect a password/passphrase question from the command. The stream streamOut should be provided to get the output and errors merged. streamErr is not used in this method (it will be empty string finally).
        Returns:
        exit code of command if execution succeeded,
        Throws:
        ExecTimeoutException - if the command failed because of timeout
        SshException - if an error occurs for the ssh connection during the command execution Note: in this method, the SSH Channel is forcing a pseudo-terminal allocation {see setPty(true)} to allow remote commands to read something from their stdin (i.e. from us here), thus, (1) remote environment is not set from .bashrc/.cshrc and (2) stdout and stderr come back merged in one stream.
        ExecException

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        : true if it is a directory, else false
